page.title: 13 Leven Coastguard
page.content: Leven coastguard station has only one full time coastguard Mr Theobald,who told us all about his work.He said he has ancillary helpers who are ready to drop everything and go when needed. The main station is at Fife Ness which is responsible for many miles of coastline.The coastguards watch for signs of bad weather and look out for ships in trouble but they could be called out to rescue people cut off by the tide or children stuck on cliffs. Only recently,Mr Theobald said,a mine left over from the war had been found on a beach and bomb disposal men had to be called in.The R.N.L.I. provide lifeboats,helicopters are stationed at Leuchars but common equipment like ropes is kept at their stations. They sometimes get hoax calls but they'd rather go out and find a mistake had been made than a life lost
